page.title: 12COTTERSTOCK
page.content: Cotterstock is a small linear settlement one mile north of{Oundle} surrounded by arable farm-land. It has a population of about 100. The school has closed and the small number of children in the village must go to Oundle. It has an Early English church, St.Andrew's, in which there is a fine brass. The houses are mainly large and probably expensive, many of them now owned by commuters who work outside the village. The largest building, Cotterstock Hall, is not open to the public. New housing has been created by conversion and 'in-fill' building. Cotterstock Mill is no longer working and is owned by an agricultural supplier. The village which is designated a Conservation Area, has no shops, post-office or public house but the old school is used as a village hall.
